name: 4-(4-chlorophenyl)-4-hydroxypiperidine
Reason: 4-chlorophenyl group introduces a significant dipole due to the chlorine atom, which raises the melting point by approximately +50°C. The hydroxyl group introduces a polar functional group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and rigidify the structure, estimated at around +20°C. The piperidine ring itself contributes to the melting point due to its rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at around +20°C. The presence of two phenyl groups can also contribute to the melting point due to their ability to enhance the crystalline structure and increase molecular weight, estimated at around +20°C each.
